title: How should I get passing marks in class 12 chemistry? - Quora

response.answer_text: Passing in chemistry is not a big deal. To just pass chemistry,you have to just study properly.Consider these: 1.Firstly do the chapters- Solid state,Solution,Electrochemistry,Chemical Kinetics.Complete these chapters properly. 2. From solid state,do the full chapter and yes numericals is must on the formula of Density. Solution chapter you have to study full chapter. Electrochemistry,numericals based on nerst equation,E cell,gibb’s energy and also the diagram of a cell. Do the numericals from ncert. Chemical Kinetics,do the full chapter and only ready those topics which is included in your ncert textbook. 3. Now when you are done with those chapters,do polymers and chemistry in everyday life.For these two chapters,learn all the question and answers from ncert coz from these chapters,questions are directly asked from ncert.(Note: From these two chapters,don’t do any kind of structure making or IUPAC type,only learn theory part). If you have learned these two chapters,m damn sure you will get full marks from these chapter.Just do learn the intext+ ncert exercise all question answers(except don’t go for any kind of iupac or structure type question). 5. If you have completed Solid state,solution,Electrochemistry,Chemical Kinetics,Polymers,Chemistry in everyday life. I assure you that you will definitely pass chemistry with good marks. All the best and remember study smart,don’t study hard like all those sticky insects.

It's not a big deal . If you see the previous year question papers you can easily find the important topics . You need not to study each and every thing at this hour . Look for the formulas of ELECTROCHEMISTRY, CHEMICAL KINETICS, SOLID STATE etc . If you simply remember the formulas and you get a question related to that you can easily solve it. Revise P, D and F block elements along with the coordination chemistry chapters . Also chapters like polymer, biomolecules, chemistry in every day Life should not be taken for granted . All together they can be asked for 10–12 marks. All the name reaction should be memorised if possible . There are Chances they can be asked directly . Stick to whatever you have prepared so far . Revise again and again. Keep calm and read the question carefully before writing answer. All the best.

Don’t think for just passing but try to score high. solid statesolutionchemical kineticsElectrochemistrysurface chemistrymetallurgyBiomoleculeschemistry in everyday lifepolymersDo these chapters by heart and you will pass the exam easily. Please buy Last 10 years asked question books they are very helpful. And if you want some marks then you can do some more chapters of inorganic and organic you can easily score above 40 out of 70. Thank you so much 🙏🏻 P.S : I scored 41 out of 70 by doing just these chapters And try to at least answer every question like write something relevant you’ll surely get marks.

That means you require 23–27 mks !!!!! So here is what you can do start with inorganic chemistry NCERT from intext questions to the back exercises just try to memorise them theses questions will give you an insight to the whole chapter , and if you have any reference books then pls do questions from them. One question for sure is going to come form solid state simply learn the basics life formulas and the packing efficiency etc. Learn the basic formulas from electrochemistry if direct question would come then you will be able to answer that. from surface chem memorise the bulk topics like micelle formation, sols, collidal solution, emulsification, adsorption isotherm and enzymes. for org part take one sheet (2–3) and write all the name rxns and the catalyst in them pls pls pls laearn them . Make some short points for conversion problems and practice you have enough time. I won’t promise that you”ll pass but surely this could help you.

Hii Krishan You have not mentioned your board.. But i will suggest you as I have given Cbse board exams.. So if you are from cbse board then please mark my words… For getting marks in chemistry (not only passing but infact 90+) read chemistry class 12 NCERT thoroghly …. Line by line… Atleast 2 times and revise it by writing answers and solving sample paper questions… All the very best…

Answer is first you learn IUPAC names and most important chapter is ORGANIC COMPOUNDS CONTAINING C, H and O. Study the p-block and D&F block elements because every public exam they can question from this unit so study this unit and 2more unit and above units you will get pass mark garunteed.
You should be read concentrate &write chemical reactions again & again in one day & learn chemical formulas with name
